zone.line: music, and leant over me as I read or
painted. When he conversed with me his
manner was cold and constrained; his
eyes only seemed to speak, and as N he
turned their black, full lustre towards
me they expressed a living sadness. There
was somthing in those dark deep orbs
so liquid, so and intense that even in
happiness I could never meet their full
gaze that mind mine did not over-
flow. ^Yet it was with tears, then those ^my tears were
sweet ^tears; but Not f now there was a depth
of affliction in their gentle appeal
that rent my heart with sympathy;
they seemed to desire peace for me;
for himself a patient heart to hears
patient to suffer; a craving for
sympathy, yet a perpetual self
denial. It was only when he was
absent from ^me that his passion sub-
dued him, – that he clenched his
hands – knit his brows – and with
haggard looks called for death to his
